measured_by: percent of pre-move fixations on the square where the move appeared (eye-tracking)
justification: “Prediction accuracy is the percent of fixations at empty squares that were focused on the move that was shown.”

measured_by: log probability of the move from the gameplay model
justification: “Move probability is the log probability according to the gameplay model of the move that was shown.”

measured_by: participant’s recall of the move location by clicking on the board
justification: “Participants were then shown the boards again and asked to recall the move that was placed on each board by clicking on the corresponding location.”

measured_by: self-reported confidence rating on a 1–9 scale
justification: “After each recall, they also rated their confidence about the move on a scale of 1 to 9 (with 9 being most confident).”

measured_by: coefficient of the move-probability regressor (β_p) from regression on retrieval fixations
justification: “The coefficient of the move probability regressor (β_p) represents how often a participant was fixating on likely but incorrect squares during retrieval for this move, indicating schema use.”

measured_by: coefficient of the correct-move regressor (β_m) from regression on retrieval fixations
justification: “The coefficient of the correct move regressor (β_m) represents the extent to which a participant looked specifically at the correct move, indicating retrieval of an episodic memory.”
